VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Health Sciences?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Health Sciences is arc {Engineering}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Health Sciences?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Health Sciences is arc {Business}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Health Sciences} has the largest input flow.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Engineering and Health Sciences in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Engineering and Health Sciences is {288}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between Business and Health Sciences in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between Business and Health Sciences is {572}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Engineering?
SC.A: The total flow output from Engineering is {604}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Engineering?

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 441? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {572} from {Health Sciences} to {Business}, a flow of {730} from {Business} to {Health Sciences}, a flow of {567} from {Business} to {Engineering}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 441? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {100} from {Health Sciences} to {Engineering}, a flow of {288} from {Engineering} to {Health Sciences}, a flow of {316} from {Engineering} to {Business}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 194 and 569? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {288} from {Engineering} to {Health Sciences}, a flow of {567} from {Business} to {Engineering}, a flow of {316} from {Engineering} to {Business}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Business to Health Sciences or from Health Sciences to Engineering?
NC.A: The flow from {Business} to {Health Sciences} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Health Sciences to Engineering, from Business to Engineering, or from Health Sciences to Business?
NC.A: The flow from {Health Sciences} to {Business} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Business}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Business} and {Health Sciences}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Engineering, Arc Business, Arc Health Sciences}.
